@graph.text: Are you a fan of mushrooms?

headline: Beef Wellington
name: Beef Wellington
recipeInstructions: Using kitchen twine, tie tenderloin in 4 places. Season generously with salt and pepper.  Over high heat, coat bottom of a heavy skillet with olive oil. Once pan is nearly smoking, sear tenderloin until well-browned on all sides, including the ends, about 2 minutes per side (12 minutes total). Transfer to a plate. When cool enough to handle, snip off twine and coat all sides with mustard. Let cool in  fridge. Meanwhile, make duxelles: In a food processor, pulse mushrooms, shallots, and thyme until finely chopped.  To skillet, add butter and melt over medium heat. Add mushroom mixture and cook until liquid has evaporated, about 25 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then let cool in fridge.  Place plastic wrap down on a work surface, overlapping so that it’s twice the length and width of the tenderloin. Shingle the prosciutto on the plastic wrap into a rectangle that’s big enough to cover the whole tenderloin. Spread the duxelles evenly and thinly over the prosciutto.  Season tenderloin, then place it at the bottom of the prosciutto. Roll meat into prosciutto-mushroom mixture, using plastic wrap to roll tightly. Tuck ends of prosciutto as you roll, then twist ends of plastic wrap tightly into a log and transfer to fridge to chill (this helps it maintain its shape). Heat oven to 425°. Lightly flour your work surface, then spread out puff pastry and roll it into a rectangle that will cover the tenderloin (just a little bigger than the prosciutto rectangle you just made!). Remove tenderloin from plastic wrap and place on bottom of puff pastry. Brush the other three edges of the pastry with egg wash, then tightly roll beef into pastry.  Once the log is fully covered in puff pastry, trim any extra pastry, then crimp edges with a fork to seal well. Wrap  roll in plastic wrap to get a really tight cylinder, then chill for 20 minutes. Remove plastic wrap, then transfer roll to a foil-lined baking sheet. Brush with egg wash and sprinkle with flaky salt.  Bake until pastry is golden and the center registers 120°F for medium-rare, about 40 to 45 minutes. Let rest 10 minutes before carving and serving.

video.description: Trust us, your effort will pay off big time.
video.name: This Beef Wellington Will Wow Your Dinner Guests

review.reviewBody: This was challenging without a food processor and only a 1/2 lb of tenderloin. We had never worked with puff pastry before and we didn't care much for the taste of prosciutto. So by the time it went into the oven, I was frustrated and we weren't expecting this to be so amazing. It was! It was SO good that we are willing to do it again. I only wish I had taken a photo after cutting it in half- it was food magazine grade perfection!
I'm always interested in new recipes. I would like to  make the beef wellington  but my daughter  is allergic  to mushrooms. What if anything could I  use in  place of mushrooms?

Just made this for guests. It turned out amazingly! I marinated the beef overnight in red wine,  olive oil and garlic but that was the only change I made, apart from cooking it in a roaster with a grill to prevent sogginess underneath. It really was easy to make. The video helped a lot.
We cooked this for Christmas and it was fantastic. So much food to feed the family and lots of leftovers!
I never thought I could make Beef Wellington! Thanks for the confidence boost! It was amazing and such a great way to wrap up the year! Cheers to 2021!
My son followed this recipe for our Christmas welly dinner, it was a little rarer than we like our tenderloin but overall very good. Will definitely make it again but will cook in the skillet longer!

People are so negative with their reviews and thumbs down(s). Don’t bother if your comments suck. Where would you start from if nice people like this didn’t share their recipes and others didn’t contribute? Idiots... 

This recipe rocks!  Great for people who aren’t trying to make a 4 star Gordon Ramsey recipe because we aren’t all Gordon Ramsey.... It was a FANTASTIC compromise! Turned out GREAT! THANK YOU so much for posting this!!!!!

description: Make this Beef Wellington from Delish.com when you want to impress someone.
keywords: beef wellington, beef tenderloin, puff pastry, mushrooms, prosciutto, dinner party recipes, entertaining recipes,
